verb.description: Re-examine and make alterations to (written or printed matter)
examples: the book was published in 1960 and revised in 1968

verb.description: Reread work done previously to improve one's knowledge of a subject, typically to prepare for an examination.
examples: revise your lecture notes on the topic

noun.description: A proof including corrections made in an earlier proof.

origin: Mid 16th century (in the sense look again or repeatedly (at)): from French réviser look at, or Latin revisere look at again, from re- again + visere (intensive form of videre to see).
